meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be understood or explained.
meanings.sent1: The interpretability of the instructions made it easy for everyone to follow.
meanings.sent2: Scientists strive for interpretability in their research findings to ensure clarity.
meanings.sent3: The interpretability of the joke left everyone laughing for hours.
meanings.sent4: Her interpretability of the painting revealed hidden meanings to the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The interpretability of the map helped travelers navigate through the city with ease.

meanings.definition: The ability to make sense of or understand something.
meanings.sent1: The interpretability of the data allowed the team to draw meaningful conclusions.
meanings.sent2: Teachers aim to enhance students' interpretability of complex concepts.
meanings.sent3: The interpretability of the magic trick left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: His interpretability of the ancient text shed light on its historical significance.
meanings.sent5: The interpretability of the song lyrics resonated with listeners on a deep level.
